author: holgerd77
content: <@!425615769280315392> so for detection if a client can speak the `wit/0` protocol I send a respective status message and see if there is some response? Is this the way to go?

author: jason.carver
content: Sorry, for detecting what? `wit/0` is announced like any typical devp2p subprotocol. If a client claims to support `wit/0`, then you can go straight to calling `GetBlockWitnessHashes` to get the list of trie node hashes for a specific block. See https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/caps/wit.md
